result.execSummary:
The defendant Harold G. TOMS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Obstruct Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To Judith Englebrecht, joint and several with Casey Scherer.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample.

Defendant is to have no contact with Casey Scherer.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 04-12-16 at 2:00 p.m.
Plea date is set for 06-24-16 at 9:00 a.m.
Minutes.

Attorney Belville was just appointed and requests an adjournment.
Time limits have been previously waived.
Preliminary hearing reset for 03-11-16 at 8:30 a.m.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 01-08-16 at 9:00 a.m.    
Minutes.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess illegally obtained prescription, theft by fraud, PTC theft by fraud, burglary, theft from vehicle, misappropriate ID information, receive stolen property and obstruct officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 12-14-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with Casey Scherer, Judith Engelbrecht or her residence at 910 S. 39th Street, Manitowoc, WI.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
